story: You are looking for a digital camera. You’re helping at a coastal bird sanctuary where sightings can happen either right by the boardwalk or way out across the lagoon. You travel light and don’t want to juggle or swap lenses when a heron lifts off or a wren pops into view. Most of your shooting is handheld, and you frequently frame tall subjects on reeds or tree trunks, so it needs to feel just as steady and comfortable when you’re holding it upright as when you’re shooting horizontally. You often jump from wide habitat context to tight detail on a distant subject in seconds, and setting up a tripod isn’t realistic with wind and passing foot traffic. At the end of each session you like to beam a few clips and photos straight to your phone at the visitors’ center to show the education team that same day. You don’t care about cinematic bells and whistles; clean, dependable footage and reliable reach matter most, along with an all-day carry you can keep ready in your hands rather than in a bag.
